00040 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00042 
00043 #ifndef PIZ_FINITE_STATE_H
00044 #define PIZ_FINITE_STATE_H
00045 
00046 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00047 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048 
00049 #include "pizDataStructures.h"
00050 
00051 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 
00054 /**
00055  * \ingroup finiteState
00056  */
00057  
00058 typedef struct _PIZFiniteStateNode {
00059     long            value;                      /* Value of the node. */
00060     bool            final;                      /* Terminal node state. */
00061     PIZItemset128   parents;                    /* Arcs (indexes as bit field). */
00062     PIZItemset128   childs;                     /* Arcs (indexes as bit field). */
00063     } PIZFiniteStateNode;
00064 
00065 /** 
00066  * \remark  Implemented with an array of bounded queues, one per alphabet's value (alphabet is 0-127). 
00067  *          Bounded queues contains indexes of pre-allocated nodes (pool size is 128).
00068  * \ingroup finiteState
00069  */
00070  
00071 typedef struct _PIZFiniteState {
00072     long                count;                  /* Number of nodes in the automaton. */
00073     long                shuttle;                /* Index of the playback head. */
00074     long                lotteryIndex;           /* Number of elements in the lottery array. */
00075     long                jumpChance;             /* Cumulative chance to jump when reading. */ 
00076     long                thresholdToMergeNodes;  /* Number of nodes to start crossing-over. */ 
00077     long                *lottery;               /* Temporary array for lottery drawing. */ 
00078     PIZBoundedQueue     **mapByValue;           /* Pointer to the array of bounded queues. */ 
00079     PIZBoundedStack     *ticketMachine;         /* Pool management. */ 
00080     PIZFiniteStateNode  *stock;                 /* Pool of nodes. */ 
00081     } PIZFiniteState;
00082     
00083 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 
00086 PIZ_START_C_LINKAGE
00087 
00088 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 
00091 /**
00092  * \brief   Create the automaton.
00093  * \details The function accept one argument : the threshold to start crossing-over. 
00094  *          Minimum is 1, maximum is 100, default is 35.
00095  *          In case of failure the pointer is NULL.
00096  * \param   argc The number of arguments.
00097  * \param   argv A pointer to arguments.
00098  * \return  A pointer to the new automaton.
00099  * \remark  The following shows how to create an automaton.  
00100  * \code
00101  * long args = 50;
00102  *
00103  * PIZFiniteState *fsa = pizFiniteStateNew (1, &args);
00104  * PIZFiniteState *fsa = pizFiniteStateNew (0, NULL); // default value
00105  *
00106  * \endcode
00107  * \ingroup finiteState
00108  */
00109 PIZFiniteState *pizFiniteStateNew (long argc, long *argv);
00110 
00111 /**
00112  * \brief   Free the automaton.
00113  * \details It is safe to pass NULL pointer. 
00114  * \param   x A Pointer.
00115  * \ingroup finiteState
00116  */
00117 void pizFiniteStateFree (PIZFiniteState *x);
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * \brief   Add values to the automaton.
00121  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00122  * \param   argc The number of values.
00123  * \param   argv A pointer to the values.
00124  * \return  An error code.
00125  * \remark  The number of nodes can not be more than 128 at a given time, exceedings ones will be ignored.
00126  * \ingroup finiteState
00127  */
00128 PIZError pizFiniteStateAdd (PIZFiniteState *x, long argc, long *argv);
00129 
00130 /**
00131  * \brief   Clear the automaton.
00132  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00133  * \ingroup finiteState
00134  */
00135 void pizFiniteStateClear (PIZFiniteState *x);
00136 
00137 /**
00138  * \brief   Fill a given array with automaton values.
00139  * \remark  Each step the playback head randomly moves in the automaton. 
00140  *          It does not reverse. At the end of a branch, it jumps. 
00141  *          Each step, chances to jump increase (terminal states raise it more).
00142  * \param   argc Number of step to proceed.
00143  * \param   argv Pointer to the array.
00144  * \return  An error code.
00145  * \ingroup finiteState
00146  */
00147 PIZError pizFiniteStateProceed (PIZFiniteState *x, long argc, long *argv);
00148 
00149 /**
00150  * \brief   Get the number of nodes in the automaton.
00151  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00152  * \return  The number of nodes.
00153  * \ingroup finiteState
00154  */
00155 long pizFiniteStateCount (const PIZFiniteState *x);
00156

00160 PIZ_LOCAL PIZ_INLINE PIZError pizFiniteStateMergeNodes (PIZFiniteState *x);
